conclusion: Two harmonic transverse waves propagate along the positive and negative directions of the x-axis, respectively.
Wave sources are located at x=-0.2m and x=1.2m, with both waves having a wave speed of 0.4m/s and an amplitude of 2m.
Particles P and Q at equilibrium positions x=0.2m and x=0.8m just begin to vibrate at t=0.
Equilibrium position of particle M is located at x=0.5m.
The task is to determine the time when the two waves meet.
Wave 1 starts at x = -0.2 m and travels in the positive x direction.
Wave 2 starts at x = 1.2 m and travels in the negative x direction.
The waves will meet at the midpoint between their sources.
Midpoint x coordinate is calculated as (âˆ’0.2 + 1.2)/2 = 0.5 m.
Wave 1 travels from x = -0.2 to x = 0.5, covering a distance of 0.7 m.
Wave 2 travels from x = 1.2 to x = 0.5, covering a distance of 0.7 m.
Both waves have a speed of v = 0.4 m/s.
Time t for each wave to travel 0.7 m is calculated as t = Distance/Speed.
Time t is calculated as 0.7/0.4 = 1.75 s.
The two waves will meet at the midpoint at time t = 1.75 s.
Final Answer: The two waves meet at t = 1.75 s.
